entry.title: Notify FSP Service observers on shutdown
entry.content:
- file_system_provider::Service is a keyed service while

OneDriveIntegrationServiceAsh isn't.

On OneDriveIntegrationServiceAsh destruction, the observer

tries to remove itself from the FSP service which

is no longer there, so it crashes.

- Changed file_system_provider::Service to notify its

observer when the shutting down starts.



Bug: b:329305132

entry.title: Fix issues with OSExchangeData update
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/c/5362199, GetString and GetURLAndTitle were

updated to use std::optional as were all callers.



In the original code in menu_view_drag_and_drop_test.cc, two calls

to GetString didn't check for the boolean return value, but fell

back on default-constructed strings, which can safely be compared

to a constant. The new code didn't check the success, but had no

fallback, so comparison to a constant would crash. That's a

regression in behavior, so add a default value to the calls.



Bug: 328710562

Change-Id: I3f17376c4dd50b422e74964d872fe5e2a7b7c20d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5372831

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Auto-Submit: Avi Drissman

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1273228}

entry.title: [URL] Support empty hosts in relative URLs for non-special base URLs
entry.content:
Update Chromium's handling of relative URLs by allowing them to have

empty hosts (like "///path") when used with non-special base URLs.



Before:



> const url = new URL("///path", "git://host/a") ;

=> throws an Invalid URL error.



After:



> const url = new URL("///path", "git://host/a") ;

=> `url' is valid. url.href is "git:///path".



This change basically implements "host state" in URL Standard:

https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#host-state



> 2.1. If url is special and buffer is the empty string, host-missing

> validation error, return failure.



Prior CLs already implemented this, but was not implemented correctly in resolving relative URLs for non-special base URLs.



While the WPT URL tests have a good coverage for these scenarios, I also

added unit tests for additional assurance.



Bug: 40063064

Change-Id: I46786955d5db27d29864e80a259ce4076500cb33

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5364453

entry.title: Remove FixedFlatSet use in PolicyWatcherTest.
entry.content:
MakeFixedFlatSet is only for building compile time maps. As such, there

are restrictions on when it can be used: in particular, the set itself

must be constructed with a constant expression, which means any

variables used in the initializer must also be constexpr variables or be

constant-initialized variables. A forward-declared extern variable is

neither of these.



Rather than trying to make the initializer a constant expression, just

use base::flat_map: since this is test-only code, there is no

implication on production code anyway.



Bug: 41486252

Change-Id: Ic8555b23e95b28bafdb036a0eb5fcccb2634aebf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5372938

Auto-Submit: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Joe Downing

Commit-Queue: Joe Downing

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1273225}

entry.title: Notify of video visibility changes through media session
entry.content:
This change allows the routing of video visibility changes notifications, reported by |HTMLVideoElement::ReportVisibility|, through MediaSession.



|MediaSessionImpl| iterates through all |normal_players_|, if any of them has a sufficiently visible video, MediaSession will set |meets_visibility_threshold| to true, and false otherwise.

entry.title: Pass synthetic Sec-Purpose header to shouldOverrideUrlLoading
entry.content:
When Prerender2 is enabled on WebView, the embedder will need to be

able to distinguish prerender navigation vs other navigation.

To enable that without a WebView API change, we pass `Sec-Purpose`

header to `WebResourceRequest` that `shouldOverrideURLLoading` takes

as its `request` argument. [1]



[1] https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebViewClient#shouldOverrideUrlLoading(android.webkit.WebView,%20android.webkit.WebResourceRequest)



Bug: 41490450

Change-Id: Ia181730f01d40ed699fb3441e3dba59ce0414770

entry.title: webnn: Use ASSIGN_OR_RETURN in //services/webnn/tflite
entry.content:
Replaces most uses of RETURN_IF_ERROR with this macro, which improves

readability. Specifically, it allows for replacing many uses of "auto"

(previously used to hide overly-verbose expected types)

with the type of the assigned variable after unwrapping the

expected. See

https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Type_deduction



This CL contains no functional changes

entry.title: Revert "Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9808ffb946ced743655507f56986b0fe9cea5019.



Reason for revert: Breaking ThirdPartyCookieDeprecationObserverMechanismBrowserTest.ThirdPartyJavaScriptCookieReadAndWrite on linux-chromeos-chrome



Original change's description:

> Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants

>

> This CL set precedence to allow first priority consideration of our long term solutions, to enhance visibility on their web ecosystem adoption.

> Similarly, sites controlled mechanisms should be check before Chrome

> ones, and user controlled mechanisms should come last as in an ideal

> scenario users shouldn't need to trigger them.

>

> The predefined and defaulted controls will always come first.

>

> OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism2 is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism3

>

> OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus2

>

> OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests2 is replaced by API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests3

>

> OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment is replaced by Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment2

>

>

entry.title: [URL] Support resolving an opaque path with non-special base URLs
entry.content:
Fix the wrong result in resolving an opaque path with non-special base

URLs.



Before:



> const url = new URL("git:opaque", "git://host/a") ;

> url.href

=> "git://host/opaque"



After:



> const url = new URL("git:opaque", "git://host/a") ;

> url.href

=> "git:opaque"





URL Standard says "if url is special" in 2.6 of scheme-state:



https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#scheme-state



> 2.6. Otherwise, if url is special, base is non-null, and base’s scheme

> is url’s scheme:



However, our implementation didn't implement this condition check.



While the WPT URL tests have a good coverage for these scenarios, I also

added unit tests for additional assurance.



Bug: 40063064

Change-Id: Ic9f9b4c3b55bd2cac0c8993638e55fc8d9cf8180

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5364258

entry.title: [FS Shortcut] Make HandleUserHeldEscape() a virtual function
entry.content:
This CL expands the ExclusiveAccessControllerBase interface to include

new functions that will be used to handle press-and-hold Esc events. It

also moves the press-and-hold timer from KeyboardLockController to

ExclusiveAccessManager so that the logic can be shared by the

controllers.



This is purely refactoring and does not include any feature change.

entry.title: Implement MediaVideoVisibilityTracker
entry.content:
The MediaVideoVisibilityTracker allows tracking and reporting whether a

given HTMLVideoElement meets a desired visibility threshold.



This functionality will be used as one of the signals to allow AutoPip

for video elements that are sufficiently visible.



Also, update SimTest to clear lazy loaded style sheets, to fix

blink_unittests_v2 test failures. Similar to what has been done with

previous blink_unittests_v2 migrations (e.g.

https://crrev.com/c/5113710).

entry.title: [App Service] Add Crosapi support for the apps::PackageId type
entry.content:
PackageId is used in apps::App, so this allows publishers running in

Lacros to set an `installer_package_id` on their apps.



There's some difficulty due to possible version skew allowing a kUnknown

app type to be received. We handle this by allowing the PackageId to be

in an "unknown" state. Ideally I think we'd rather use a

std::optional, and have unknown IDs become

std::nullopt. I haven't figured out a way to make this possible within

the Type Traits system.

entry.title: gardening: Fix ProxyManagerTest.ProxyRequestRateLimitBurst
entry.content:
This CL fixes flaky ProxyManagerTest.ProxyRequestRateLimitBurstdue to

unretained dangling ptr.



There are delayed tasks which does not run in time, so we should wait

for all tasks to complete on TearDown.



Ideal fix is to find the such tasks and resolve base::Unretained, but

the problem is most likely inside mojo implementation which is hard to

investigate, so we wait for all the tasks to complete here to fix the

builder for now.

entry.title: [Extensions] Introduce ShellExtensionsRendererAPIProvider
entry.content:
Introduce a ShellExtensionsRendererAPIProvider to handle the

API-specific bits of exposing APIs in the renderer to the

//extensions/shell layer.



Because //extensions/shell predominantly only includes those APIs that

are available in the //extensions layer, this provider is fairly

light -- the notable bit is moving the webview modules out from

the DispatcherDelegate into the ExtensionsRendererAPIProviders. This

includes both the Chrome-layer version (requiring

"chromeWebViewElement") and the shell layer (requiring

"extensionsWebViewElement").

entry.title: Revert "Allow child processes to inherit logging file handle on Windows"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b80a478f9f8bff1fb9001d249ca8c09105fd3405.



Reason for revert: ContentBrowserTest.RendererCrashCallStack failing

on asan builds.



Original change's description:

> Allow child processes to inherit logging file handle on Windows

>

> Child processes on Windows cannot always open their log file

> (for instance if they cannot determine the user-data-dir) making

> configuration of logging complicated. Child processes also need

> a sandbox exception to open their log files.

>

> This CL replaces logging related flags to pass a handle to children

> in cases where a file would have been passed, allowing a later CL

> to remove the sandbox rule allowing direct access to the log file.

>

> If the browser is run with `--enable-logging --log-file=file`,

> children will now be run with `--enable-logging=handle --log-file=N`.

> It is not possible to mix stderr logging with file logging (it will

> still work for the browser process), but this already does not work

> in official builds as std handles are not passed into children.

>

> This also allows the CHROME_LOG_FILE to be useful again for renderer

> processes if Chrome is run using:

>

> $env:CHROME_LOG_FILE="d:\temp\env-log.log"

> chrome.exe --enable-logging

>

> the browser will inspect the env var and provide a handle to that

> file when starting renderer processes.

>

> Running the browser with --enable-logging=handle directly is not

> supported, these flags should only be provided by the browser when

> starting child processes.

>

> Tests: Manually tested results https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Hq37YReGM91fmcCcqkRbjtjwP62FVH_zpZtfpSPlLeY/edit?usp=sharing

> Bug: 328285906, 40270808

> Change-Id: Id79731b2d35ab3ee58f6c1612990bdec1485da68

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5337202

entry.title: [remoting host] Don't report INCOMPATIBLE_PROTOCOL when channel is closed
entry.content:
It appears that the host reports INCOMPATIBLE_PROTOCOL error even when

it's the user clicking the disconnect button on the client. The problem

seems to be that the control channel is closed, and the existing code

just believes that it is unexpected and disconnects the session with the

INCOMPATIBLE_PROTOCOL error.



I don't see why we can't change the error code to be report to OK. There

is a OnWebrtcTransportError() which should supposedly handle error

cases. Based on my observation, the control channel is closed only when

the user clicks disconnect, or closes the tab on the client. If I just

kill the Chrome process, then the host will seemingly be unaware of the

peer going offline (which sounds like another bug, filed

crbug.com/329716908).



Given this, this CL just changes the error code to OK. This might

potentially introduce false negatives that I'm not aware of, but I think

the overall accuracy is higher if we report OK.



Bug: 329551346

Change-Id: I315caa56dbef0537367021e98d941dd90c7e9e53

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5371975

entry.title: Add option to set TrayBubbleView as activatable
entry.content:
This CL adds an init_param option to make a `TrayBubbleView` activatable

on click or tap events.

This CL does not change any current behavior.



Additional context:



TrayBubbleViews are not activatable by default, the RerouteEventHandler

sets them as activatable when a keyboard event is detected so the

bubble can get focus. For some bubbles like the NotificationCenterBubble

we need them to get focus after clicks/taps like when clicking on a

reply button on a notification. This is currently handled in an obscure

way by a `ClickActivator` in `NotificationViewBase`. We should handle

this in TrayBubbleView logic instead and clean up `ClickActivator`.



Bug: 329712701

entry.title: heatmap: reconnect to ml service with exponential backoff
entry.content:
Whenever we lost connection to ml service, we retry it after 1 second,

if we keep failing, we will retry with exponential backoff with max

interval as 10min.



This solves the problem that heatmap service couldn't start properly

on reboot because ml service is initialized after evdev.

entry.title: NotifierCollision: Fix crash when accessing item.popup invalid pointer
entry.content:
There can appear a scenerio when NotifyPopupClosed() is called and

then CloseAllPopupsNow() is triggered. For example:

- A popup is disappearing, MessagePopupView::~MessagePopupView() is called, which calls NotifyPopupClosed() and makes item.popup a nullptr.

- At the same time a tray bubble is open, causing the popups to be closed, NotifierCollisionHandler then calls ClosePopupItem(), which calls item.popup->Close() on a null item.popup and cause the crash.



ClosePopupItem() assumes a popup is always valid, which might not be the case when we introduce NotifierCollisionHandler, so we should check for that before using the pointer to avoid crashes.



This CL also add some other nullptr checks, and close the widget before

removing it from the list to make sure no dangling widget left behind.



Bug: b:312515706

Change-Id: Ia5c61223105be9693420957a11e6f7e853dde934

entry.title: [Read Anything] Refactor Reading Mode handling of PDFs.
entry.content:
Previously, when a user opened a PDF with with reading mode enabled,

reading mode would do the following:

1. ReadAnythingUntrustedPageHandler in the browser process sends

AXTreeID of web contents to ReadAnythingAppController in the

renderer process.

2. Controller and ReadAnythingAppModel determine whether the web

contents is for a pdf by checking the url (this was delicate

because it required the url ending with ".pdf" which isn't always

the case).

3. If the web contents is for a pdf, controller sends a message

back to page handler that it's for a pdf.

4. Page handler begins to observe the pdf web contents and sends its

AXTreeID to the controller.



This CL remove the back and forth between the browser and renderer.

Page handler figures out whether a web contents is for a PDF by

checking if it has an inner web contents, and if that inner web

contents has a pdf extension origin. It then sends the correct

AXTreeID to controller.



Controller and model still need to know whether the AXTreeID

corresponds to a PDF because there are certain formatting changes we

do in that case, such as modifying the html tag.



Fixed: 41496290

Change-Id: Ibcb50bbb96994bb01125de60024a4d8b1535a9c5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301501

entry.title: WebUI Path Mappings: Allow mapping more import types
entry.content:
Instead of only allowing mapping for 2 types:

"chrome-untrusted://" + scheme-relative imports

"chrome://" + scheme-relative imports



Also allow 2 more options, useful for some build_webui() targets:

"chrome://" imports only (needed by PDF Viewer component extension)

Relative imports only (useful for targets containing code shared with

both trusted and untrusted UIs).



This is done by changing the is_untrusted boolean parameter to a

webui_context_type parameter with 4 options:

"trusted": Map trusted and scheme-relative imports (default)

"untrusted": Map untrusted and scheme-relative imports

"trusted_only": Map only trusted imports

"relative": Map only scheme-relative imports



This is in preparation for setting the |webui_host| parameter, used to

compute |webui_context_type|, in more places. This will enable

detection of imports from incorrect schemes at build time.



Bug: 328733315

Change-Id: I7e8980d1232bedcb9ea680f2720f365c3a4e66dc

entry.title: [Interop] For UseNameFromSelectedOptions elements, fall back to value
entry.content:
When computing the accessible name for an embedded control, if it's

a combobox or listbox the spec [1] says to use the "text alternative

of the chosen option." In some cases, however, it's reasonable for

a combobox not to have a chosen option, and its value can be given

by its descendant content [2].



The spec could be clearer about this ([3], [4]), but the intent is

for the value of the control to be used in such cases. So, in this CL

we fall back to using the value of the control when getting the value

contribution to name for a combobox/listbox that does not have a

selected option.



An alternative I attempted was to have

AXNodeObject::GetValueContributionToName unconditionally return

SlowGetValueForControlIncludingContentEditable() for combobox/listbox

roles. However this fails because

SlowGetValueForControlIncludingContentEditable() returns empty

for

entry.title: Add DnsTaskResultsManager
entry.content:
This is a part of the new DNS ServiceEndpoint Request API. See the

description of the associated issue for details.



DnsTaskResultsManager creates and updates intermediate service

endpoints while waiting for the all DNS responses. It delays service

endpoint creation until AAAA is responded or timed out.

entry.title: Clear changed status of ScrollPaintPropertyNode after update
entry.content:
We call SetNeedsCommit for a ScrollHitTest layer if the scroll node

has changed flag set, but previously we didn't clear the flag.



Now clear changed flag from TransformPaintPropertyNodeOrAlias::

ClearChangedToRoot(). Now ClearChangedToRoot() functions are all

implemented differently in specific classes, so the generic one

is moved from PaintPropertyNode to ScrollPaintPropertyNode.



This is required by crrev.com/c/5368550.

entry.title: Reland "Use HostResolver::Host for HostRsolverManager::JobKey"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit ba0ceec6ba98e7be9cafa2ba3f020bcea2b27569



The original CL was reverted since it made

HostResolverManagerTest.DeleteWithinCallback. Fixed the flakiness by

using the same port to associate all three requests in the test with

a single HostResolverManager::Job, which is the assumption of the

test.



The DeleteWithinAbortedCallback should cover different ports cases.



Original change's description:

> Use HostResolver::Host for HostRsolverManager::JobKey

>

> Before this CL, HostResolverManager::JobKey didn't include port for

> scheme-less requests to dedupe Jobs. However, this behavior becomes

> problematic when we want to create intermediate endpoints from partial

> DNS responses in the middle of a job, as the job needs to know the

> requested port to create appropriate IPEndPoints. This CL uses

> variant to pass the requested port to

> avoid the problem.

>

> This change could duplicate Jobs when two requests came in at the same

> time for the same domain but different ports. However, this is a

> corner case and the duplication wouldn't matter much.

>

> Bug: 1206799,41493696

> Change-Id: Ib33503f168116c26a60cec5ef0f53af7df21a5c8

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5358533

> Commit-Queue: Kenichi Ishibashi

> Reviewed-by: Eric Orth

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271865}



Bug: 1206799,41493696

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5368783

entry.title: Revert "Improve SharedImageFactory with GrContextType::kNone"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 530c1a753fadea628530793485b46bb2fcb446b0.



Reason for revert: Fails Android WebView tests on some devices.



Original change's description:

> Improve SharedImageFactory with GrContextType::kNone

>

> When SharedImageFactory is initialized with kNone context type GPU

> SharedImageBackings aren't used outside of swiftshader WebGL. Ideally

> only GLTextureImageBackingFactory would be needed for swiftshader WebGL

> but other factories, eg. IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory, are being used

> today. Don't initialize Skia specific backing factories as a step

> towards improving things.

>

> Also fix SharedImageFactoryTests to pass in SharedContextState to avoid

> having to handle null context state.

>

> Bug: 41497046

> Change-Id: I0e6af3390ba19f208a9736c12e9ea7093915c323

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277603

entry.title: [UniversalInstall] Show only Open App or Add to Homescreen
entry.content:
This limits the Universal Install items to show only one

(menu item in the app menu) or the other, but not both.



Also, streamline the onAppDataFetched function a bit.
